titleStmt.title: B. D. Williams to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2469

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: I write you request an official favor for a friend of mine in Denver City Colerado Territory.
It is that you will appoint M A. O McGrew Commissioner for Ky to take acknowledgments of Deeds &c for the Territory of Colerado.
Mr McGrew is desirous of this appointment and I am satisfied of his fitness to discharge its duties well, pleasend to my address Denver City at your earliest convenience.

I leave here in a few days for Colerado. and should
again be a candidate for congress. whether the Republicans will hat me time will tell, but Il give them a good fight.
Any sudgestions from you would be thankfully recd.
Accept me well wishes for your speedy recov from the accident which you lately met with and believe me as ever

Comr of Deeds
A. O. McGrew
Denver City

Enclose Comission to ^Hon.^ B. D Williams of Danville, Care M. J. Durham Esq
B. M
